programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: Britains most talented detectives tackle a dangerous arsonist in Bristol, a drug smuggling operation in Manchester, and a family committing shocking animal cruelty in Cheshire

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: Special police task forces tackle a brutal stabbing of a 16-year-old boy in Preston two days before Christmas, and Northamptonshire police target a drug-dealing gang on an estate

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: The team is given two days and a $20,000 budget to remove a 10-metre steel-hulled yacht from Cockburn Beach in Western Australia. The problem is the boat is buried deep in the sand and is a danger to beach goers. Heavy machinery specialist Ryan is going to use his monster excavator to try and get the job done, but theres a catch - to make the budget work, Luke needs Ryan to be done and dusted in 24 hours.

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: The team heads to Harvey Estuary in Western Australia to try and recover a 36-foot plywood vessel called Endeavour II that sunk in a wild storm. What appears to be a straightforward job on paper turns into an absolute nightmare. Job two is a charitable cause close to Lukes hear, as he and Jacinta team-up with mens mental health charity Squared Away to try and rescue a historic boat that is about to sink

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Bob Mortimer, Kimberly Wyatt, Ross Noble and Jimi Mistry are among the celebrities hoping to raise money for charity as Sean Kelly opens more mystery storage containers. The host also welcomes Shaun Ryder and Bez, Jenny Eclair and Lizzie Roper, along with Jimmy Bullard and Carl Froch

programme.title: Celebrity Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Johnny Vegas, Nancy DellOlio, Tim Vine and Chris Kamara fight for the lots at auction

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: A trawler demolition bites back for Team Salvage as a five-metre-long crocodile patrols the area, and Shaun and Sarah dig deep as a wreck on the beach pushes them to the edge

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May each buy a rear-wheel-drive coupe for £1,500 and find themselves entered into a French ice race. Richard discovers a way to fill the waiting time for flights by inventing the sport of airport-vehicle racing, Jeremy gets behind the wheel of the BMW Z4, and actress Sienna Miller is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are each challenged to find a classic car at auction for £3,000. Exploring whether they are more fun to drive than modern alternatives, the trio then take the vehicles to Majorca to compete in a rally. Jeremy also test-drives the BMW Z4 and Nissan 370Z, and AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Rick Steins Road to Mexico
programme.desc: The chef continues down the Californian coastline immortalised by John Steinbeck, a region of citrus groves and vineyards. On the edge of Los Angeles, Rick discovers Olvera Street, where the Hispanic origins of the city took root. Then heading south to San Diego, he meets 79-year-old Peter Halmay, the oldest sea-urchin diver in town, and is served the best fish chilli he has ever had by a local fishmonger

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Chicken and Egg
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers set out to discover why French chickens have gained a reputation for being the poshest birds on the planet. Beginning their quest in Lyon, the pair discover the origins of haute cuisine, before heading to a farm for an introduction to the famous poulet de Bresse. They also enjoy chicken dishes created by some of the countrys finest chefs, and then head for Daves new home in Northern France to prepare a feast for his neighbours. Finally, the boys arrive in Paris, where they cook an iconic French casserole, coq au vin, against the backdrop of the Eiffel Tower

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon introduces a seasonal special of the comedy panel game. Musical comedian Bill Bailey, actor and writer Ruth Jones, comedian and presenter Jo Brand and athlete-turned-presenter Kelly Holmes join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack, trying to hoodwink their opponents with a few festive fibs or facts about themselves

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Reeta Chakrabarti, Olga Koch, Andrew Maxwell and Gareth Thomas test their general knowledge skills in the weeks penultimate edition

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, Jodie Kidd, Jamali Maddix and Suzi Perry test their general knowledge skills ahead of Fridays final

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz with a difference, joined by guests Sue Perkins, Jimmy Carr, Jack Dee and regular panellist Alan Davies. The presenter asks questions of a gothic nature, awarding points for the answers he finds most interesting

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Hillary and Trae moved into their spacious 1970s split-level home eight years ago - they have an open layout and so must renovate everything all at once

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Tenny and Lyle are excited to bring their two families together, but they need a game-changing renovation to make the house work for a more family-oriented lifestyle

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles is in Bidford-on-Avon, Warwickshire, to meet Chloe, who has a rare genetic disorder that means she has to stay in the living room of her familys house under constant care. The DIY SOS team are joined by Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and hundreds of Warwickshire volunteers to redesign the entire house to provide Chloe with independence, creating a self-contained apartment complete with bedroom, wet room and sitting room

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: Judge Andy Allen presents an Everything Mystery Box to challenge the contestants with unusual flavours to be combined into one dish

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Life on the Edge
programme.desc: The film-maker looks back on his documentaries about the criminal justice system in the US. Louis reflects on his reports on the prison system, which exposed a world with its own rules and codes and a system that seemed to be broken. He also revisits the documentaries he shot in Philadelphia and Milwaukee, where tensions between the African-American community and the police were already at boiling point years before the death of George Floyd

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Life on the Edge
programme.desc: The film-maker looks back on his documentaries focused on families, including his trilogy of documentaries centred around the Westboro Baptist Church. He examines how the death of patriarch Fred Phelps has left members of the church divided. He also reflects on how physical and mental health or forces beyond control can threaten to derail family lives

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Return of the documentary capturing daily life on the busy maternity ward in Southmead Hospital, Bristol. Mel, 35, is expecting fourth-generation twins and when her waters break, the expectant mum has to choose whether husband Chris or her identical twin sister Cheryl will be her birthing partner. Larger-than-life Su, 36, felt she had hit the jackpot when she met younger man Dan, 28, and the couple arrive at Southmead in high spirits. Their baby is in breech so the couple have been booked for a Caesarean - but their plans soon change. Meanwhile, Rob is praying for a son as partner Katy is rushed to the delivery suite

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: When Marion, 30, and Rachel, 32, wanted to start a family they went in search of a sperm donor and ended up with twins, but at their 30-week scan, the couple are told one of the babies is not growing properly and they must return to Southmead Hospital the next day for a C-section. Image-conscious Sarah, 28, and her husband, 40-year-old personal trainer Rob, reach a compromise over baby names in the delivery suite, while 39-year-old Ollie arrives armed with blankets, rugs and all the essentials to make sure his expectant wife, 33-year-old Kate, is as comfortable as possible

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers go back to school as they transform students common rooms - and Michelle Ogundehin ups the stakes by telling them that the weakest two will be eliminated this week. Arriving at Gordano School in Bristol, the contestants work in pairs to update the four tired areas - one for each house in the school - as well as adjoining teachers offices. Alan Carr follows their progress, while guest judge Sophie Robinson offers her thoughts on the finished designs

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Anna and Darren treat a woman suffering from terminal cancer. Laura and Kerry are called to attend a young man with a painful abscess in his throat

programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: Nick helps a family of four in Stanwell who are paralysed by their clutter. Mum Kelly and dad Paul had always rented properties, but their first family home is now full of unnecessary furniture and items that left them feeling trapped. Nick and the team wade through hundreds of DVDs, books and toy cars to clear the mess and give mum, dad and the two kids a fresh start

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Stephanie lived in one home growing up and Brian moved around a lot as a kid - the two have moved six times since they started dating and now want to settle down

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS at Great Ormond Street Hospital
programme.desc: The DIY SOS team are out of their comfort zone this week, joining forces with two world-famous institutions - Great Ormond Street Hospital and the Chelsea Flower Show - for a special challenge. Gardener Chris Beardshaw has promised his gold medal-winning garden from the flower show to the hospital - now all Nick Knowles and his fellow builders have to do is crane the display across London and rebuild it on the hospital. Its a hugely ambitious build, with tricky logistics and emotional volunteers. But knowing how much the garden will prove welcome respite for families, the team is determined not to fail

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: The winners of the previous round battle it out in an elite service challenge with chef Hugh Allen at Vue de monde

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: The paramedics of the West Midlands Ambulance Service are sent out to help an unconscious man who has overdosed on heroin, and a schoolboy who has had a seizure

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A woman fights for her life after being knifed by her former partner, while a teenager on her way to seeing two YouTube stars in a live appearance is felled by a falling tree

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: Paramedic Kim climbs into a crushed car balanced over a fast-flowing river, while services across the Pennines are paralysed when a man plunges from a bridge onto a busy rail line

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina decides to soak away her worries in a flotation tank and is amazed at its life-changing effects on both herself and those around her - so amazed that she agrees to adopt a Romanian orphan and even attends an open day at Saffrons school. Award-winning comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina takes time out from being PR guru to the countrys biggest stars to become involved with Patsys fashion magazine. Cosmo and Vogue beware - two new lushes are in town. Comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley, with guest appearances by Dawn French and Adrian Edmondson

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina hits 40 and goes into a panic at the realisation that she now officially has one foot in the grave - so Saffy decides to cheer her up by throwing a party. Unfortunately, the guests fail to get along, and it all ends in tears. Hit comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley, Julia Sawalha and June Whitfield

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers hit the high street in Salisbury, where they work in pairs to give three retail businesses - a bridal shop, a homeware shop and a lingerie shop - a new lease of life. The designs range from the theatrical, with bold colours and wallpapers, and a cool, contemporary theme, to a safe, colourless look that plays into the hands of an owner who was worried about change. Alan Carr follows their progress, while retail expert Mary Portas joins Michelle Ogundehin to offer her thoughts on the finished designs

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Sam and Tony are called to a woman suffering excruciating stomach pains, but soon find themselves dealing with a sudden seizure. Dino and Dave try to help a baby

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives at a milestone on his American journey as he reaches the boundary between the northern and southern states, known as the Mason-Dixon line. Beginning in Wilmington, North Carolina, he uncovers the history of gunpowder production in Delaware, before heading to Baltimore, where he discovers how the first American steam engine owed a lot to British technology. On the citys east coast, Michael visits the star-shaped Fort McHenry, and learns how the Star-Spangled Banner national anthem was born

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Continuing his trek from Philadelphia to Jamestown, Michael Portillo arrives in the nations capital, Washington, DC, centre of political power in the worlds most powerful country. Steered by his Appletons Guide of 1879, he admires its fine public buildings, including the largest library in the world, and discovers how the capital was built from scratch after a political compromise between north and south. After this, he travels on to Mount Vernon, exploring a former slave market and visiting an archaeological dig along the way

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek waxes lyrical about a pristine Jaguar XJ8 and a Ford Model T van tests his driving skills

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek travels to the Yorkshire coast to pick up a 1963 Austin J2 Paralanian campervan, described as the Rolls Royce of campervans.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. The first edition focuses on the Channel Island of Guernsey, which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The search for Josef Mengele, one of the most wanted Nazi war criminals, which was led by Holocaust survivor Simon Wiesenthal

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Tewkesbury Abbey, Gloucestershire. A visitor from Australia hopes a set of silver knives will be worth the cost of her plane ticket, while two sisters who split their great great grandmothers jewellery between them hope to find out who has the most valuable inheritance. Lennox Cato values a box that may have belonged to William Shakespeares wife, and a collection of rare figures and dolls turns out to be a find of national importance

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Audley End, Essex, where experts value a sword that played an important role in the end of the American War of Independence, a collection of toilet chains and a silver container that once contained a goats gallstone believed to have magical powers. The biggest shock of the day comes when Eric Knowles reveals the worth of a set of three vases decorated with fairies

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek picks up some emerging sporting classics from the Far East when three Datsun Zs appear, and an unusual lot arrives that run on caterpillar tracks not wheels

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek auctions off some vehicles that were used in the TV show Heartbeat. Theres love for an Austin Cambridge and a sporty Italian number finds a new home

programme.title: Operation Arctic
programme.desc: Originally broadcast live from the Arctic, this series follows the struggles of polar bears living on this frozen tundra and highlights the impact that environmental changes are having on the bears and the changing world around them. Simon Reeve, Kate Humble and Gordon Buchanan examine the effects of climate change and the struggles these bears now face as the sea ice continues to melt at an alarming rate

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: Derek points the team towards one of his favourite motors - a 1983 Daimler Double Six. And a Triumph 2000 is given a modern day makeover under the bonnet

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus buy a Porsche 923 with a cracked interior, bad paintwork and ripped seats. This driving legend is well past its best, but they still hope to turn a profit

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Wiltshire Henry and Simon meet Laura who lives in a collection of farm buildings. Henry takes a hay cart and Simon falls in love with some glass collecting jars

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring the remains of an ingenious sky-high solution to a ground-based problem, Chiatura, once know as the Venice of the air

Simon Reeve, Kate Humble and Gordon Buchanan examine the effects of climate change and the struggles these bears now face as the sea ice continues to melt at an alarming rate

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Manassas, Virginia, scene of two crucial battles during the American Civil War. In Fredericksburg, he tries bottling bourbon corn whiskey and learns how it became the nations spirit. In Richmond, the ex-politician enjoys a tour of the Virginia state Capitol building, where he hears of the dilemma faced by one of its most famous sons, General Robert E Lee, before donning his dancing shoes for a Cotillion ball. Michael ends his journey in Jamestown, the first permanent English settlement in North America

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.sub-title: St Louis to Jefferson City, Missouri
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his American rail journey west to Jefferson City, Missouri, following the tracks of European settlers in the 19th century. In St Louis he ascends Americas monument to the Wild West, the Gateway Arch, the tallest free-standing monument in the US. On the banks of the Missouri River, the political commentator is invited aboard a replica of the original keel boat used for an historic expedition. In Washington, Missouri, Michael tries to craft a corn cob pipe, and in Jefferson City he finds an huge fortified building that served as the gaol for the entire Wild West

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads to Sunderland to pick up a real Italian beauty - a 1972 Lancia Fulvia Zagato. Red and racy, the car has seen better days, but Dereks still impressed

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Up for sale at the Mathewsons auction - a 1275 Mini GT thats come from just down the road that could be a future British icon

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The Jewish group the Avengers who, as the Second World War was ending, hunted down persecutors known to have contributed to deaths during the Holocaust, including Wilhelm Stuckart

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a second visit to Audley End House, Essex, where items up for valuation include a large bronze cockerel that was buried during both world wars to escape being melted down for ammunition and a table that Napoleon may have signed his abdication on. One visitor to the show has a fascination with design diagrams inspired by an earlier episode - and brings in a collection of 650

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Hanbury Hall, Droitwich, where unusual objects brought in to be valued include a 10 foot-long narwhal tusk and an unusually large fishing rod that was used during the First World War. Plus, Hilary Kay discovers what smell can reveal about an objects past, and John Benjamin values four buttons that were bought for £2 - but may be worth considerably more

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare Honda S800 sports car from 1967 takes Dereks fancy, and a couple of very different Ford Capris with long histories go head to head at the auction

programme.title: Wales: Land of the Wild

programme.title: Cold Case Forensics
programme.sub-title: Cold Case Forensics: The Murder of Stephen Lawrence
programme.desc: The racist murder of Stephen Lawrence in southeast London in 1993 remained unsolved for more than a decade. Eventually forensic scientist Dr Angela Gallop and her team were brought in by a new investigation to look again at the evidence. Here she and her colleagues, as well as detective Clive Driscoll and the Lawrence familys lawyer, Imran Khan, detail how this landmark case was finally brought to trial

programme.title: Criminal Assets Bureau
programme.desc: A week after the murder of Veronica Guerin in June 1996, the Oireachtas passed the Proceeds of Crime Bill, and by October the Criminal Assets Bureau (CAB) was a fully functioning agency of the state. Since then CAB has completely changed the way organised crime is policed and become a blueprint for fighting organised crime on an international level. For the almost 50 per cent of the population under 35, this is ancient history. This series looks at the agencys first 25 years and shows the Irish public CABs importance at both a national and international level, especially its role as a model for seizing the assets of organised crime worldwide

Jean is determined to prove the accused is innocent and calls in the team for assistance, but with the evidence stacked against her, Alice is quietly resigned to the fact she will hang for the crime. programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. After seven years of ducking the issue, Lewis and Hobson are embarking on a relationship, but the detective also has a new case to solve. programme.title: UEFA European Qualifiers 2025/26 - Live
programme.desc: Northern Ireland v Slovakia (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the FIFA World Cup Group A qualifier, held at Windsor Park. Northern Ireland won their opening match in the group 3-1 in Luxembourg, before putting in a credible performance away to Germany but eventually losing by the same scoreline. The Slovaks have maximum points so far after claiming a fine 2-0 win at home to the Germans, before producing a considerably less inspiring performance in Luxembourg, but still prevailing thanks to a last-minute goal. This is the first meeting between the side since a UEFA Euro 2020 play-off here, which Slovakia won 2-1 after extra time, with Michal Duris scoring the winning goal
